thread.title: Thousands cast early votes for Louisiana election
thread.title_full: Thousands cast early votes for Louisiana election - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: FOX8Live.com Staff
title: Thousands cast early votes for Louisiana election
text:
NEW ORLEANS (WVUE) - Top gubernatorial candidates are preparing to square off in a FOX 8 and Raycom debate.
Thousands of voters have already made their decision.
Senator David Vitter is not expected to be at the debate Monday night and continues to avoid media attention during the final stretch of the election season.
Still, he maintains a hopeful chance, as more than 222,000 people in Louisiana have already voted early.
The greatest amount of early voters in our area live in St. Tammany Parish. More than 14,000 thousand people there voted
In Orleans Parish, there were just under 13,000 early voters.
Still, the gubernatorial race is far from over.
A FOX 8 | Raycom poll shows that both Vitter and lone democratic candidate, State Rep. John Bel Edwards are leading the race. Vitter is at 21% and Edwards is at 24%.
Monday night at the governor's mansion, Edwards will take the stage along with Louisiana Public Services Commissioner Scott Angelle, and Lt. Governor Jay Dardenne.
As for Vitter, political analyst Mike Sherman says that even though his numbers are hopeful right now, they are not set in stone.
"It looks like John Bel Edwards is a bet to make a run off. The question is can David Vitter remain on top of that Republican pack or will something happen here in this last week to change the fundamentals in this election," Sherman said. "David Vitter is being a very disciplined candidate, not showing up at debates, staying away from the media spotlight, thinking that if he sits atop, he can focus on a run off."
You can watch the debate Monday at 7 p.m. on Louisiana Raycom stations.
The election is Saturday.
Copyright 2015 WVUE .
